text.0:
Gold and silver ornaments along with Rs 27.44 lakh in cash were found in the locker of Mahabubnagar district municipal commissioner Vadde Surendar who was arrested for taking a bribe by the Anti-Corruption Bureau (ACB).

https://t.co/LZW64yxPWj
text.1:
Dr. Reddy’s Laboratories Ltd announced that Parag Agarwal will be joining the company as chief financial officer (designate) on November 2.

Parag is a qualified CA and company secretary. He joins Dr. Reddy’s from Reckitt Benckiser PLC, where he was CFO.
https://t.co/cLuwaMneFB
text.2:
(ACB) on caught red- handed two police officials, a sub-inspector and a constable,  taking a bribe of Rs 30,000.

According to the ACB, Gandhinagar SI Lakshminarayana demanded a bribe of Rs 50,000 from a complainant in connection with a cheating case.

https://t.co/TZgRtDd64x
text.3: Telangana State Police bagged Skoch Gold Award in the category of Response to Covid-19. @TelanganaDGP M.Mahendar Reddy,  has shared the screen to receive the award in a virtual award ceremony. https://t.co/gEGSr0Ptfc
text.4:
A court in Warangal  awarded death sentence to Sanjay Kumar Yadav, accused in the sensational mass murder of 9 migrants, including a child, that occured in May 2020

The bodies of 9 migrant workers, including six of a family, had been recovered from a well
https://t.co/7jAtMxDasa
text.5:
(ED) has provisionally attached 21 immovable properties, held in the name of Polepalli Venkata Prasad and his family members, and deposits of Rs 50 lakhs with an ARC firm, Meliora Asset Reconstruction Company, totaling to Rs 7.57 crore, under the  (PMLA)

https://t.co/SWnCaokXGe
text.6:
The court at LB Nagar sentenced a man to life imprisonment for killing his mother.

In July 2016, Yadamma, 80, who was a resident of Gurramguda, Saroornagar mandal in was found dead with an injury to the head and nail marks on the throat. @rachakondacop
https://t.co/LLH1QkxcSS
text.7: #Warangal: A court in Warangal district had awarded death sentence to Sanjay Kumar Yadav, accused in the sensational mass murders of nine migrants including a child in May 2020. After conducting the trial in the case, the court on Wednesday pronounced the verdict.
text.8:
A tipsy man was found asleep on his bike in the middle of the road at Madhapur on Tuesday

He was discovered by Cyberabad Traffic Command & Control Center through CCTV footage while he was asleep. Officials found his BAC reading was 334 mg/100 ml of blood
https://t.co/Bh2lQPNeWS
text.9:
#Telangana reported 1,481 new COVID cases on Tuesday taking the overall tally to 2,34,152 in the state.

Four new deaths are reported on October 27 taking the total tally to 1,319. The fatality rate in the state is 0.56 per cent

https://t.co/DrUWGSHRlT
text.10:
#Fact-check - It is clear that Pogba has not quit football because of President Macron’s comments on ‘Islamist terrorism’. Thus, the claim is FALSE

https://t.co/JhFEoKJWhr
text.11:
#Siddipet police have arrested five persons for snatching Rs 12.80 lakh cash that was seized by the cops from the residence of BJP Dubbaka candidate M Raghunandhan Rao’s relative.

Of Rs 12.80 lakh stolen cash, police have recovered Rs 27,500 so far.
https://t.co/zz2Z2XIT5J
text.12:
Unidentified burqa-clad kidnappers abducted a 57-YO dentist in full public view at #Bandlaguda .

The victim has been identified as Behjaat Hussain.

However based on an alert @APPOLICE100 intercepted the kidnappers and rescued him.
https://t.co/NcDMfyewUi
text.13:
National Commission for Backward Classes  issued a show-cause notice to @TelanganaDGP asking as to why a case should not be registered against the officers involved in the arrest of BJP state president and Karimnagar MP @bandisanjay_bjp in Siddipet. 

https://t.co/WrNVM4kWQS
